title: A Counterexample in Ito Integration Theory. (arXiv:2305.10695v1 [math.PR])
abstract: Ito's Lemma implies that if $W$ is a Wiener process and $f$ is a twice continuously differentiable function, then the process $f(W)$ is the sum of a time integral and an Ito integral. The Ito integrand is not necessarily locally square integrable. This note provides a counterexample.
context:
Title: A Counterexample in Ito Integration Theory. (arXiv:2305.10695v1 [math.PR])
Abstract: Ito's Lemma implies that if $W$ is a Wiener process and $f$ is a twice continuously differentiable function, then the process $f(W)$ is the sum of a time integral and an Ito integral. The Ito integrand is not necessarily locally square integrable. This note provides a counterexample.
translated_abstract: Ito引理表明，如果$W$是一个维纳过程，$f$是一个二次连续可微函数，则过程$f(W)$是一个时间积分和一个Ito积分之和。但是Ito积分被积函数不一定是局部平方可积的。本文提供了一个反例。
tldr: 本文提供了一个反例，证明了在Ito积分理论中，Ito积分被积函数不一定是局部平方可积的。
en_tdlr: This paper provides a counterexample showing that the integrand of Ito integral is not necessarily locally square integrable in Ito integration theory, despite Ito's Lemma.
